Description: Limestone ostracon: on the recto thirteen lines of text, incomplete on the left and at the bottom, recording a judicial proceeding before the local court of the necropolis workmen. The case concerns a complaint by the workman Amenemope about a woman who had been mistreated by her husband. On the verso eleven lines of text, incomplete on the right and at the bottom, recording another judicial proceeding before the local court. This case concerns a probably similar complaint by the workman Neferhotep (a son of Naunakht and Khaemnun).
Curator's comments: Bibliography: J. J. Černy and A.H. Gardiner, ‘Hieratic Ostraca’ (Oxford 1957), p. 16 and pl. LIII, 2; S. Allam, 'Hieratische Ostraka und Papyri aus der Ramessidenzeit' (Tubingen, 1973), no. 221, pp. 221—2; K. Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' V (Oxford, 1982), 471-2.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136401) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136401)
